sentence: Stepan Company ( SCL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on March 01, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.205 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased SCL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 7.89% increase over prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of SCL was $74.23, representing a -14.68% decrease from the 52 week high of $87 and a 49.96% increase over the 52 week low of $49.50.
SCL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
SCL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.67.
Zacks Investment Research reports SCL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 5.41%, compared to an industry average of 8%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the SCL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
